abstract: A unique identifier for a player of the game.
overview:
## Discussion

This identifier is unique to this game instance if the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/scopedIDsArePersistent()] method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. Otherwise, this identifier is the same across all game instances. An instance is the time between when the game launches and when the game terminates.

For the local player (a [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKLocalPlayer] object), this identifier is persistent across all local player instances of the game. If the player is friends with the local player, this identifier is persistent across all local player and friend game instances. To determine whether the player is a friend, use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKLocalPlayer/loadFriends(_:)] method.

To protect the player’s privacy, use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/gamePlayerID] property instead of the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/teamPlayerID] property. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/protecting-the-player-s-privacy-using-scoped-identifiers].

If you transfer your game to another developer, the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/gamePlayerID] property is the same for the new developer. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/transfer-an-app/overview-of-app-transfer].

# gamePlayerID

**Instance Property**

A unique identifier for a player of the game.

## Declaration

```swift
var gamePlayerID: String { get }
```

## Discussion

This identifier is unique to this game instance if the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/scopedIDsArePersistent()] method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. Otherwise, this identifier is the same across all game instances. An instance is the time between when the game launches and when the game terminates.

For the local player (a [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKLocalPlayer] object), this identifier is persistent across all local player instances of the game. If the player is friends with the local player, this identifier is persistent across all local player and friend game instances. To determine whether the player is a friend, use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKLocalPlayer/loadFriends(_:)] method.

To protect the player’s privacy, use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/gamePlayerID] property instead of the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/teamPlayerID] property. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/protecting-the-player-s-privacy-using-scoped-identifiers].

If you transfer your game to another developer, the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKPlayer/gamePlayerID] property is the same for the new developer. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/transfer-an-app/overview-of-app-transfer].

## Identifying the player

- **teamPlayerID**: A unique identifier for a player of all the games that you distribute using your developer account.
- **scopedIDsArePersistent()**: Returns a Boolean value depending on whether the player identifiers are persistent across game instances or unique to the game instance.
- **GKPlayerIDNoLongerAvailable**: A constant for a player ID that’s no longer available.
- **playerID**: A unique identifier for a player of the game.
